page.title: 17W.Ashby farmers wife 1935.
page.content: Between 7 and 7-30 a.m. milk is brought in to the dairy. 7.30-8.a.m. surplus milk is separated in the separator, saving cream for butter making and the bulk of the milk for the customers.8.a.m. to 9.a.m. breakfast and arrival of post.9.a.m. to 10.a.m. chickens are fed and eggs collected.10.a.m. washing up including the separator and cleaning the dairy. cream is put away for butter making later in the week.The rest of the morning is spent bed making,cleaning and preparing midday meal.12.30 to 2.p.m. dinner followed by a quick glance at the daily paper and checking the post.2.p.m. washing up followed by any preparations that have to be made for the evening meal.After that out on the farm feeding chickens and collecting eggs.Oil lamps must be filled and coal and logs fetched in
